intro: Luisma bivascularis, commonly known as the two-veined luisma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and alternate, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous small seeds. Luisma bivascularis is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
